Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of the FLARE™ Imaging System for Sentinel Lymph Node Mapping in Breast Cancer Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved 6 women undergoing sentinel lymph node (SLN) mapping for breast cancer at a single surgical center.

Participants.evidence: 6 women undergoing sentinel lymph node (SLN) mapping for breast cancer at a single surgical center.

Intervention.evidence: Participants received 99m Tc-sulfur colloid lymphoscintigraphy and 12.5 µg of indocyanine green (ICG) in human serum albumin (HSA) as an NIR fluorescent tracer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the number of SLNs identified by NIR fluorescence compared to 99m Tc-lymphoscintigraphy, measured intraoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved 6 women undergoing sentinel lymph node (SLN) mapping for breast cancer at a single surgical center.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A total of 9 SLNs were identified by both 99m Tc-lymphoscintigraphy and NIR fluorescence, with discrepancies in two patients.
